articles.author: Nutrition Research Team
articles.title: Optimal Prenatal Vitamin Formulations: Bridging the Nutrient Gap
articles.description: Analysis of 180 commercial prenatal supplements reveals widespread inadequacies in key nutrients like vitamin D, choline, and omega-3s :cite[1]:cite[7].
articles.content: Blood levels of 11 essential vitamins decline during pregnancy without supplementation. Current prenatal formulas often fail to meet evidence-based targets for folate (400 mcg), iron (27 mg), and vitamin D (2000-4000 IU)...

source.name: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists

articles.title: ACOG Guidelines: Folic Acid & Neural Tube Defect Prevention
articles.description: 400 mcg folic acid recommended pre-conception, reducing neural tube defects by 50% :cite[3]:cite[7].
articles.content: Critical window for folate supplementation begins 3 months pre-pregnancy. Only 10% of African American women meet early supplementation targets...

articles.author: Clinical Nutrition Research Group
articles.title: Prenatal Supplements: Only 1 Product Meets All Targets
articles.description: Analysis of 20,547 supplements shows alarming gaps in calcium, iron, and omega-3 FA dosing :cite[4].
articles.content: Target doses: 383-943 mg calcium, 13-22 mg iron. Only 1 non-prenatal product met all 6 nutrient targets at $200/month...

articles.author: Nutrition Researcher
articles.title: The Choline Crisis: 95% of Prenatals Fail Mothers
articles.description: Most supplements provide <100 mg of crucial brain-development nutrient vs 450 mg RDA :cite[7].
articles.content: Eggs and organ meats are primary dietary sources. Quadruple RDA choline intake shows promise mitigating fetal alcohol effects...

articles.author: Genomics Research Team
articles.title: Prenatal Vitamins Alter Fetal DNA Methylation Patterns
articles.description: First-month supplementation linked to 0.6% reduction in placental DNA methylation :cite[6].
articles.content: Cohort studies show enriched methylation patterns in neuronal development pathways. Association strongest with early pregnancy supplementation...

articles.author: Ethiopian Research Consortium
articles.title: 87.5% of Ethiopian Mothers Skip Prenatal Vitamins
articles.description: Low education & unplanned pregnancies drive supplement avoidance :cite[5].
articles.content: Cultural factors: 71% of decisions made by husbands. 3.27x higher non-use with poor nutritional knowledge...

articles.author: Jordan Hylton, DO
articles.title: Vitamin D Controversy: To Screen or Not to Screen?
articles.description: ACOG finds insufficient evidence for routine vitamin D testing :cite[8].
articles.content: RDA remains at 5 mcg despite links to preeclampsia. No association found between maternal 25(OH)D and offspring bone density...

articles.author: Maternal Health Consortium
articles.title: Calcium's Dual Role: Lowering Preeclampsia & Autism Risk
articles.description: 1500 mg/day reduces preeclampsia by 55%, autism odds by 52% :cite[2]:cite[6].
articles.content: Cochrane review of 15,730 women shows 35% hypertension reduction. HELLP syndrome risk requires monitoring at high doses...

articles.author: OB-GYN Resident
articles.title: Omega-3 Shortfall: 95% of US Mothers Deficient
articles.description: 600-1000 mg/day recommendation vs typical 100-200 mg in supplements :cite[7].
articles.content: Fatty fish twice weekly reduces preterm birth risk by 37%. Mercury concerns overblown for salmon/mackerel...

articles.author: Public Health Researchers
articles.title: The Prenatal Iron Paradox: Anemia vs. Overload
articles.description: 28% of third-trimester women develop anemia despite 27 mg RDA :cite[1]:cite[8].
articles.content: Balance required: Excessive iron linked to gestational diabetes. Hepcidin monitoring proposed for personalized dosing...

articles.author: Nutrition Meta-Analysis Group
articles.title: Magnesium: The Overlooked Mineral Reducing C-Sections
articles.description: 350 mg/day supplementation decreases cesarean risk by 22% :cite[2].
articles.content: NHANES data shows 48% of women below RDA. Linked to reduced gestational diabetes and childhood asthma...

articles.author: Developmental Biologists
articles.title: Placental Epigenetics: Prenatal Vitamins' Lasting Legacy
articles.description: First-trimester use alters 9,216 methylation sites in placental tissue :cite[6].
articles.content: Neuronal development pathways most affected. Methylation changes persist into childhood developmental assessments...

articles.author: Global Health Initiative
articles.title: UNIMMAP Formula: Global Standard for Prenatal MMNs
articles.content: Contains 30 mg iron, 400 mcg folate. Adopted in 23 LMICs with 12% reduction in low birth weight...

articles.author: Carl V Smith, MD
articles.title: Weight Gain Guidelines: IOM vs Real-World Compliance
articles.description: Only 30-40% meet targets; obesity doubles preeclampsia risk :cite[8].
articles.content: Recommended ranges: 11-40 lbs based on BMI. Second-trimester gains most critical for fetal development...

articles.author: Public Health Advocate
articles.title: Prenatal Supplements: The Wild West of Nutrition
articles.description: No FDA oversight for dosage accuracy or contamination :cite[7].
articles.content: 43% of products contain unlisted ingredients. Price doesn't correlate with quality...

articles.author: Pediatric Research Network
articles.title: B12 Deficiency: Silent Threat to Neurodevelopment
articles.description: 2.6 mcg RDA often unmet in vegan/vegetarian mothers :cite[1]:cite[8].
articles.content: Linked to 34% higher autism risk. Requires separate supplementation in plant-based diets...

articles.title: Gestational Diabetes: Nutritional Prevention Strategies
articles.content: Complex carbs vs simple sugars: Glycemic load management crucial. Magnesium and chromium supplementation under study...
